title: Hands-On Design Patterns with C# and .NET Core
author: Gaurav Aroraa, Jeffrey Chilberto
description: Build effective applications in C# and .NET Core by using proven programming practices and design techniques.

title: .NET Design Patterns
author: Praseed Pai, Shine Xavier
description: Explore the world of .NET design patterns and bring the benefits that the right patterns can offer to your toolkit today

title: Applied Architecture Patterns on the Microsoft Platform (Second Edition)
author: Andre Dovgal, Dmitri Olechko, Gregor Noriskin
description: Work with various Microsoft technologies using Applied Architecture Patterns

title: Code Complete: A Practical Handbook of Software Construction
author: Steve McConnell
description: Author synthesizes the most effective techniques and must-know principles into clear, pragmatic book which will inform and stimulate your thinking and help you build the highest quality software

title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
author: Robert C. Martin
description: Best agile practices of cleaning code “on the fly” that will instill within you the values of a software craftsman and make you a better programmer—but only if you work at it.

title: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
author: Martin Fowler, Kent Beck, John Brant, William Opdyke, Don Roberts
description: Book shows how refactoring can make object-oriented code simpler and easier to maintain. Provides a catalog of tips for improving code.

title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides
description: Modern classic in the literature of object-oriented development. Offering timeless and elegant solutions to common problems in software design. It describes 23 patterns for object creation, composing them, and coordinating control flow between them.

title: Working Effectively with Legacy Code
author: Michael Feathers
description: This book describes a set of disciplines, concepts, and attitudes that you will carry with you for the rest of your career and that will help you to turn systems that gradually degrade into systems that gradually improve.

title: Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture
author: Martin Fowler
description: This book is written in direct response to the stiff challenges that face enterprise application developers. Author distills over forty recurring solutions into patterns. Indispensable handbook of solutions that are applicable to any enterprise application platform.

title: Delphi Cookbook - Second Edition
author: Daniele Teti
description: Over 60 hands-on recipes to help you master the power of Delphi for cross-platform and mobile development on multiple platforms

title: Delphi Cookbook - Third Edition
author: Daniele Spinetti, Daniele Teti
description: Quickly learn and employ practical recipes for developing real-world, cross-platform applications using Delphi

title: Delphi High Performance
author: Primož Gabrijelčič
description: Build fast, scalable, and high performing applications with Delphi

title: Expert Delphi
author: Paweł Głowacki
description: Become a developer superhero and build stunning cross-platform apps with Delphi

title: Coding in Delphi
author: Nick Hodges
description: All about writing Delphi code. It's just about how to use the language in the most effective way to write clean, testable, maintainable Delphi code

title: More Coding in Delphi
author: Nick Hodges
description: Picks up where previous "Coding in Delphi" left of, continuing to illustrate good, sound coding techniques including design patterns and principles

title: Dependency Injection In Delphi
author: Nick Hodges
description: Covers Dependency Injection, you'll learn about Constructor Injection, Property Injection, and Method Injection and about the right and wrong way to use it

title: Delphi in Depth: FireDAC
author: Cary Jensen Ph.D
description: Learn how to connect to a wide variety of databases, optimize your connection configurations, the power of persisted datasets, create flexible queries using macros and FireDAC scalar functions, achieve blazing performance with Array DML, Master the art of cached updates

title: Delphi GUI Programming with FireMonkey
author: Andrea Magni
description: Master the techniques to build interesting cross platform GUI applications with FMX

title: Hands-On Design Patterns with Delphi
author: Primož Gabrijelčič
description: Build scalable projects via exploring design patterns in Delphi

title: Hands-On Domain Driven Design with .NET
author: Alexey Zimarev
description: Learn to solve complex business problems by understanding users better, finding the right problem to solve, and building lean event-driven systems to give your customers what they really want.
